text: Sampled at CBC 2017, pours a clear gold with some clumpy, white head. Nose has honey, grass, straw, lemon. Flavor is the same, lemon, grass, honey, peanut skins. Crisp finish.

Pale yellow color with a quickly dissipating white head that left some spotty lace on the glass. Sweet grainy nose. Sweet light beer with some corn, wet grains and a bit of lemon citrus in the finish. Easy drinking macri substitute.

can to glass definite lager aroma. kind of stale straw, pale gold color white head. nothing spectacular at all just a normal kind of beer. decent straw, grass flavor hints of hops. its about what you would expect in a non macro lager.
Keg at the brewpub, 8/11/16. Clear pale golden. Aroma of pale malt and noble hops. The taste is pale, doughy malt and grassy hops. Medium bodied, well balanced.

Slightly hazy gold with a fizzy white head. Lightly sweet grain, soft earthy and slightly spicy hops. Very clean finish. This may be the ultimate tailgate brew for the whole crew. Flavorful yet mild. Very well done.

This is the beer that Budweiser thinks it is making. An excellent transition beer for introducing newcomers to craft beer. Pours clear golden pale with a minor head. Very light aroma of grass and cereal. Mild bitterness in the finish with a very refreshing mouthfeel. The Ultimate Lawnmower Beer.

Appearance: very faint clear pale golden. no head.
Nose: lightly roasted malt. Faint floral hops. Slight bitter
Taste: Similar to nose. Faint grassy and floral aspects. Mild sweetness, mild bitterness
Body: Light with decent carbonation
Parting thoughts: a very easy drinking beer. I typically like a bit more heft.
Draft to taster at Dutchs. Pours a clear golden color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have grainy malts, some sweetness, light florals, just not much to get excited about.

Draft at the Growler Bar at Kroger-Oakley. Pours a clear gold with a small white head that settles into a ring while lacing the glass. Notes of straw, light fruit, floral zest, sweat, and pale malts. Light-bodied, with moderate to medium carbonation and a mostly clean mouthfeel despite some minor sharpness and bitterness. This should wind up being a category killer in due time. Good, clean, refreshing stuff.
Draft - Light sweet grains. Clear gold with a small white head. Light sweetness, touch of grains and honey notes. Decent.
Draft - pours yellow white head- nose and taste of lemon, dark bread and touch of toast - medium body

on tap @ Warped Wing / Dayton OH --- Clear straw amber color, white head that quickly settles to the rim, blobs of lace. Taste is fizzy light malt with a small hop shot in a light, watery finish. No doubt about the 4% abv. Not a keeper.

16 ounce can, canned on date of 06/08/16. Served in a pint glass, the beer pours a slightly hazy straw gold color with maybe a quarter inch white head. Head retention and lacing are both decent enough. Aroma is subtle, the brew smells like bready malt, along with some grassy hops. Taste is similar to the aroma, but theres also a bit of apple noticeable. Mouthfeel/body is light, its smooth and goes down pretty easy. For the style of beer it is, its not bad at all. But for the price I probably wouldnt buy it very often. With that being said, its worth trying at least once and I wouldnt turn one down. $2.49 for a single can.

Draft sample. Poured clear pale color with an average frothy white head that was mostly lasting with good lacing. Light to medium balanced aroma. Light to medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Light to medium balanced flavor with a light to medium sweet finish of short to average duration.

Sample at The Ohio Taproom. Clear pale golden color with a medium thin white head that dissipates quickly to an outer ring. Spotty lacing. Aroma of malt, grassy hops and fruit. Light-bodied with flavors of mild hops, bready malt and a bit of fruity yeast. The finish is mildly bitter with a short grassy hop aftertaste. Decent overall.
